definition: few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
there is a lot to it/not a straightforward matter

sentences.english: Indeed, there are a fair number of Mr. Lonelyhearts on campus.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，孤獨先生在校園裏確實不少。

sentences.english: We thank many listeners who write to us and encourage us.
sentences.chinese: 很感謝有不少聽友寫信來給我們，鼓勵我們。

sentences.english: Of course, there are many other recommended classic song.
sentences.chinese: 當然，其他也有不少值得推薦的經典之曲。

sentences.english: I spend quite some time and energy decorating my room.
sentences.chinese: 我花了不少時間和精力裝飾我的房間。

sentences.english: A lot of expeditions stock up on that before they go.
sentences.chinese: 不少遠征團出發前，都備好大量肯達爾薄荷餅。

sentences.english: "Mistakes are being made with regard to Mido, " added the representative.
sentences.chinese: 羅馬俱樂部在對待米多的問題上犯了不少錯誤。

sentences.english: The village is no stranger to curious projects either.
sentences.chinese: 在華西村，各種奇奇怪怪的工程也不少見。

sentences.english: Many buildings are irregular " heteromorphosis" construction.
sentences.chinese: 不少樓房是不規則的“異型”建築。
左撇子科學家其實並不少見。

sentences.english: On the Monkey Mountain the monkeys frolicked and played happily, which attracted the eyes of many tourists.
sentences.chinese: 猴山上猴子們歡鬧玩耍，吸引不少遊客的目光。

sentences.english: Something happened in the late 1950s and early ’60s.
sentences.chinese: 五十年代末六十年代初有不少這種事。

sentences.english: Many farm also actively explore some personalized service to appeal to consumers.
sentences.chinese: 不少農家樂還積極開拓一些個性化服務吸引消費者。

sentences.english: The young worker found a lot of shortcomings in himself and he set about getting rid of it.
sentences.chinese: 那位青年工人發現身上有不少缺點，就着手進行改正。

sentences.english: I doubt many surgeons inthe U.S. are currently using it.
sentences.chinese: 不過我估計美國還有不少外科醫生在用腸線。

sentences.english: The wall-to-wall carpet hasn’t been updated in years.
sentences.chinese: 屋裏的地毯已經有不少年歲了。

sentences.english: Jacob suffered severe threshings and grindings.
sentences.chinese: 雅各也曾遭受過不少難忍的磨練。

definition: few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
some/a few/a little/(following an adjective) slightly ...er
in large part/the greater part/the majority
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
one after another/in succession/one by one/continuously/diverse/in profusion/numerous and confused/pell-mell
